info.name: Hikari
info.attribution:
Room layout and scripting by Shobu and LawDawg (with assistance by IndigoPotter) released to the Public Domain as CC0.

Icons on cards from game-icons.net as attributed in the About button.  Card layout by LawDawg and released to the Public Domain as CC0. Library image generated using the MyNinja artificial intelligence image generator, https://myninja.ai/, using the following prompt: "Sky sun light poetic japanese style"
info.description: A trick taking game where you see your cards through your opponents!
info.ruleText:
The deck is made of 5 suits with colored back (1-8/3p, 1-10/4p, 1-12/5p).
  Each player receives 10 cards (10 cards are undealt), face down and sorted low-to high from left-to-right. A player can see their opponents' cards, but cannot see their own cards values (only their suits).

Starting from the first player, each player will bid how many tricks they intend to collect. The game follows the classical "must-follow" trick-taking rules. Yellow is a permanent trump suit.
Score 10 points if you meet your bid goal, otherwise score -5 points per trick off your goal.  There is a safety bet, which allow you more flexibility by allowing one extra trick (ex: 3+1, mean you can aim for 3 or 4 tricks). But this bid goal will only score 5 points.
Play 4 deals, starting player will rotate at each round.
info.helpText:
- All players take seats - Click on deal button - Click on the chooser below your trick count to make a bid - Drag a card from your holder to your play area (located on the left) - Trick winner must click on the Take button to collect the trick and automatically increment the trick counter - Round scoring has to be done manually
- Click on the deal button to shuffle the cards and deal again
